description: This simulation con visualization models the cold uniform spherical collapse of open clusters as described in M. Joyce, B. Marcos, and F. Sylos Labini, "Cold uniform spherical collapse revisited", AIP Conf. Proc. 1241, 955 (2010)
README.md:
# Cold uniform spherical collapse revisited

This simulation/visualization implements a mean-field cold uniform spherical
collapse simulation from a velocity-less, uniform spherical configuration
(as is found in open/galactic clusters of stars formed from a single stellar
nursery) and the resulting ejection of mass. The model is based on the paper
"Cold uniform spherical collapse revisited" by M. Joyce, B. Marcos, and
F. Sylos Labini, published in AIP Conf. Proc. 1241, 955 (2010); see [1].

# BUILDING

The project uses CMake for building and requires the GLM, GLEW, SDL2 for
building as well as a functional OpenGL driver for the visualization.

The file "configuration.hpp.in" contains compile-time configuration options such
as floating point precision options, smoothing factors et cetera.

Note that the build-system hardcodes the resource path for shader files
in the binary, so the resulting executable sources shader files directly
from the source folder.

# RUNNING

run `twobody` or `multibody`

# REFERENCES

- [1] M. Joyce, B. Marcos, and F. Sylos Labini, Cold uniform spherical collapse revisited, AIP Conf. Proc. 1241, 955 (2010); http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.3462740 and arXiv1011.0614 (2011), http://arxiv.org/abs/1011.0614.

- [2] P. J. E. Peebles, The Large-Scale Structure of the Universe, Princeton University Press,
1980. See also C. Payne-Gaposchkin, Stars and clusters, (Cambridge, Harvard University
Press, 1979), or just https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_cluster.

- [3] A. Friedman, On the Curvature of Space, General Relativity and Gravitation 31, 1991
(1999), or just https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friedmann_equations.
